meanings.definition: Misawards: to mistakenly give an award to someone
meanings.sent1: She misawards the trophy to the wrong student.
meanings.sent2: The judges misawards the prize due to a mix-up.
meanings.sent3: The teacher misawards the certificate to the class clown by accident.
meanings.sent4: He misawards the medal, causing confusion among the participants.
meanings.sent5: The host misawards the plaque, creating a humorous moment on stage.

meanings.sent1: The misawards caused confusion among the winners.
meanings.sent2: The ceremony had several misawards that needed to be corrected.
meanings.sent3: The collection of misawards made the event memorable for all the wrong reasons.
meanings.sent4: The wall displayed a mix of rightful awards and misawards.
meanings.sent5: The museum exhibit featured a section dedicated to historical misawards.

meanings.definition: Misawards: the act of mistakenly giving an award
meanings.sent1: The misawards were unintentional but caused disappointment.
meanings.sent2: The misawards ceremony had to be rescheduled due to errors.
meanings.sent3: The misawards event turned into a comedy of errors.
meanings.sent4: The misawards process required thorough review to avoid mistakes.
meanings.sent5: The misawards incident led to new procedures to prevent future errors.
